result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Eric Michael Sandberg was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Count 1 in Deferred Judgment of Conviction.
Concurrent without prejudice to consecutive if revoked.
Defendant to report to Probation by Wednesday December 23, 2015 by 4:00 p.m.
Court authorizes transfer of Probation to Minnesota.
Bond continues until Defendant reports to Probation.

 
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with: Count 3

miscConds.notes:
$243.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 2 Case #15CF140.
$200.00 DNA surcharge to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 2 Case #15CF140.

-Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
-Random and regular testing.
-Defendant to debrief Law Enforcement and provide truthful information. 
-Maintain employment.
-Zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

timeConds.notes:
Condition time, STAYED.
Concurrent with: Count 3

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA:  Edward Minser DF ATTY:  T Gregory Amann DF: Eric Michael Sandberg appeared. Case called at 3:43. ADA Minser gives recommendations. Atty. Amann agrees.   Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to Ct 1 in15CF140 to the DJOC and G to Ct 2 and 3 in 15CF140. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1, Court signs the DJOC on todays date. Diversion coordinator to provide quarterly updates. Court finds DE guilty of Ct 2 and 3  in 15CF140.  Sentencing arguments. DE makes a statement. Crt orders: On Ct. 2 and 3 Sentence W/H
2 years probation. Probation is concurrent without prejudice to consecutive sentencing in the event of Probation revocation.
- 60 days St. Croix County Jail as a condition STAYED.
- AODA and any recommended follow through
- Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
- Random and regular testing. 
- DE to debrief with law enforcement and provide truthful information.
- Maintain employment. 
- Costs to be paid during probation.
- Zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

De to sign up for probation by Wed. 4:00pm. Court authorizes transfer of probation to MN. 
Bond continues pending DE signing up for probation.
Plea hearing at 12-21-2015 03:30 pm
